meanings.definition: A small mass of gray matter in the brain, part of the limbic system, involved with experiencing emotions.
meanings.sent1: The amygdales play a crucial role in feeling emotions.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the amygdales to understand how we experience feelings.
meanings.sent3: When the amygdales get too excited, we might feel overwhelmed by our emotions.
meanings.sent4: Her amygdales were like a storm of emotions, swirling inside her mind.
meanings.sent5: The amygdales are like tiny emotion factories in our brains.

meanings.definition: A tonsil, especially one of the two small masses of lymphoid tissue at the back of the throat.
meanings.sent1: She had to have her amygdales removed due to frequent infections.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her amygdales to check for any signs of inflammation.
meanings.sent3: His singing was so bad, it made his amygdales ache!
meanings.sent4: Her amygdales were like guards at the entrance of her throat, protecting her from germs.
meanings.sent5: The amygdales at the back of the throat are like little soldiers fighting off infections.
